title: PRM-PACK-0025: push/pull data-fabric wrappers
description:
Implement shared data-fabric transport shim for deferred network subcommands.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Defines shared request/response transport helpers used by both `pack push` and `pack pull`.
- Maps transport and server failures to refusal envelope semantics (exit 2).
- Keeps transport layer free of new domain logic (thin wrapper only).

## Notes
Concrete push/pull command wiring is tracked in separate deferred beads.

title: PRM-PACK-0024: diff subcommand implementation
description:
Implement deferred pack diff command.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Compares two pack manifests for added/removed/changed members deterministically.
- Exit 0 when no changes, exit 1 when differences exist.
- Supports human and --json outputs with deterministic ordering.

## Notes
Deferred until core seal/verify path is stable.

title: PRM-PACK-0017: seal test suites
description:
Implement focused seal tests for determinism and contract correctness.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Deterministic member ordering and manifest shape asserted with golden snapshots.
- pack_id canonical self-hash procedure validated (`pack_id` blank during hash then filled).
- Duplicate and reserved member path collisions plus empty-input refusal covered.
- Non-empty output dir refusal and no-partial-output staging behavior covered.

## Notes
Scope excludes verify/witness tests.

title: PRM-PACK-0026: Homebrew/tap release parity
description:
Implement Homebrew/tap release parity if distribution strategy requires it.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Release process updates formula/metadata deterministically with checksums from published release artifacts.
- Version bump and artifact URLs are reproducible and script-validated.
- Failure modes include explicit retry instructions and clear rollback path.

## Notes
Deferred until core release workflow is stable.

title: PRM-PACK-0028: release integrity artifacts + publish
description:
Implement release integrity artifacts and GitHub Release publishing for pack.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Consumes packaged artifacts and generates deterministic `SHA256SUMS`.
- Produces signature/certificate for checksum bundle and emits SBOM + provenance artifacts.
- Publishes archives and integrity artifacts to the versioned GitHub Release.
- Upload behavior is idempotent/retry-safe for reruns on the same version/tag.

## Notes
Depends on release build matrix artifact outputs; does not own tag/version lifecycle orchestration.

title: PRM-PACK-0002: manifest model + canonical serialization
description:
Implement typed pack.v0 manifest model and deterministic canonical JSON serialization.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Manifest struct covers version/pack_id/created/note/tool_version/members/member_count.
- Canonical serializer is deterministic across runs and platforms.
- pack_id placeholder workflow supports self-hash computation.

## Notes
Foundation for seal and verify.

title: PRM-PACK-0009: seal command orchestration
description:
Wire full pack seal command flow end-to-end.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Executes collect -> collision check -> copy/hash -> type detect -> manifest finalize.
- Uses staging directory + atomic promotion; target non-empty output directory refuses.
- Supports `--output` and `--note` options.
- Emits `PACK_CREATED` outcome with exit 0 on success.

## Notes
All refusal mappings should route through shared refusal layer.

title: PRM-PACK-0031: deferred pack push wrapper
description:
Implement deferred `pack push` wrapper.

## Acceptance Criteria
- `pack push <PACK_DIR>` publishes pack by `pack_id` idempotently.
- Successful publish returns exit 0 with deterministic status output.
- Transport/server failures map to refusal envelope (exit 2).

## Notes
Depends on shared transport shim and manifest/pack_id contracts.

title: PRM-PACK-0030: witness behavior integration tests
description:
Implement witness behavior integration tests.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Witness append/no-witness behavior tested for seal and verify without changing domain exits.
- Witness write-failure path warns but preserves domain outcome semantics.
- Witness query/last/count human and `--json` behavior tested with synthetic ledgers.

## Notes
Complements refusal envelope integration tests.

title: PRM-PACK-0004: artifact collection + path normalization
description:
Implement deterministic artifact discovery and safe member-path normalization for pack seal inputs.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Accepts files and recursively walks directories while collecting only regular files as members.
- Produces deterministic member candidates sorted by bytewise path order.
- Normalizes member paths to safe relative POSIX-style paths (no absolute paths, no `..`).
- Non-regular inputs (symlink/socket/device/FIFO) refuse with `E_IO`.

## Notes
Input collection only; no copying/hashing yet.

title: PRM-PACK-0020: CI quality gates + test matrix
description:
Establish core CI baseline parity with rvl standards.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Adds CI workflow at `.github/workflows/ci.yml` for pull_request and push-to-main.
- Core lanes run formatting/lint/unit tests (`cargo fmt --check`, `cargo clippy --all-targets -- -D warnings`, `cargo test`).
- Toolchain setup and cache strategy are deterministic/reproducible across runs.
- CI output includes concise local reproduction commands for failed core lanes.

## Notes
Smoke/integration lanes and final required-check aggregation are tracked separately.

title: PRM-PACK-0005: duplicate member collision detection
description:
Detect path collisions in resolved member set before copy.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Duplicate member path collisions are detected deterministically after normalization.
- Reserved member path `manifest.json` is rejected as `E_DUPLICATE`.
- Collision detail includes deterministic source paths for diagnosis.
- No partial copy or partial output directory writes occur after collision detection failure.

## Notes
Depends on normalized member paths from collection step.

title: PRM-PACK-0008: pack_id computation + manifest writer
description:
Implement manifest finalization and pack_id self-hash computation.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Manifest is assembled with `version`, `created`, `note`, `tool_version`, `members`, `member_count`, and `pack_id=""` before hashing.
- Canonical JSON of full manifest is used to compute deterministic `sha256` pack_id.
- Final `manifest.json` is written with computed `pack_id` and consistent `member_count`.
- Hash procedure matches verify-side recomputation contract.

## Notes
Critical integrity contract bead.

title: PRM-PACK-0011: verify schema checks for known artifacts
description:
Extend verify to schema-validate known JSON members.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Known member artifacts (lock/report/rules/etc) validate against local schema catalog only (no network fetch).
- Schema failures report as INVALID findings (exit 1), not refusals.
- Missing local schema for a known type is recorded as deterministic `skipped`, not INVALID.
- `checks.schema_validation` semantics are deterministic (`pass | fail | skipped`).
- Integration tests cover all three schema outcomes (`pass`, `fail`, `skipped`).

## Notes
Best-effort for known types only.

title: PRM-PACK-0014: operator manifest + --describe
description:
Implement compiled-in operator.json and --describe path.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Embedded operator manifest matches plan contract and subcommands.
- Manifest refusal map matches implemented refusal codes and exit semantics.
- --describe prints manifest and exits 0 before input validation.
- Regression test asserts manifest contains expected command/refusal/exit metadata.

## Notes
No network behavior claims beyond deferred scope.

title: PRM-PACK-0027: release build matrix + artifact packaging
description:
Implement release build matrix and artifact packaging for pack.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Release workflow includes deterministic multi-target build matrix (linux x86_64/aarch64, macOS x86_64/aarch64, windows x86_64).
- Builds use locked toolchain/dependency mode and produce reproducible archive names by version + target.
- Each archive contains the packaged binary plus README and LICENSE.
- Build artifacts are uploaded for downstream release jobs.

## Notes
Focuses on build+package only; signing/SBOM/provenance and GitHub Release upload are tracked separately.

title: PRM-PACK-0018: verify test suites
description:
Implement focused verify tests for core OK/INVALID/REFUSAL outcomes.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Valid pack verifies OK (exit 0).
- Tampered/missing members, pack_id mismatch, unsafe/duplicate/reserved member paths, extra files, and non-regular member targets produce INVALID (exit 1) findings.
- Malformed or unreadable pack directories refuse (exit 2).
- JSON output assertions include deterministic `checks` and invalid finding codes for core integrity checks.

## Notes
Schema-validation outcome tests are tracked separately in PRM-PACK-0011.

title: PRM-PACK-0022: README parity with rvl style
description:
Upgrade README to rvl-level usability and depth.

## Acceptance Criteria
- README begins with a concise what/why section and a Quickstart block with copy-paste commands for pack seal, pack verify, and pack witness last.
- Includes at least one successful flow example (exit 0) and one refusal example (exit 2) with expected outcome wording.
- Documents v0.1 boundaries explicitly (diff, push, pull deferred) and witness defaults (no-witness behavior).

## Notes
Friendly up top, deep technical sections lower.

title: PRM-PACK-0019: refusal envelope integration tests
description:
Implement refusal envelope integration tests.

## Acceptance Criteria
- All refusal codes (`E_EMPTY`, `E_IO`, `E_DUPLICATE`, `E_BAD_PACK`) validated with deterministic detail payloads and stable envelope shape.
- Refusal mapping for both seal and verify command paths is covered.
- Refusal output contract (stdout envelope + exit 2) is asserted for representative failure cases.

## Notes
Witness behavior coverage is tracked separately.

title: PRM-PACK-0007: member type detection
description:
Implement type detection and artifact_version extraction for members.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Type mapping follows plan contract for known version markers (`lock.v0`, report versions, `verify.rules.v0`, `pack.v0`, profile YAML markers).
- Registry members from materialized registry artifacts map to `registry` deterministically.
- Unknowns map to `type=other` deterministically.
- `artifact_version` is populated when version markers are available.

## Notes
No schema validation yet.

title: PRM-PACK-0010: verify command integrity checks
description:
Implement pack verify for membership and hash integrity validation.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Validates manifest presence/parse, member_count consistency, member path uniqueness, reserved-path rule, safe relative paths, and closed-set root (no extra files).
- Validates each member is regular/non-symlink, hashes every member, and recomputes `pack_id` using canonical manifest procedure (`pack_id=\"\"` during hash).
- Returns exit 0 for OK, exit 1 for INVALID integrity findings, exit 2 for refusal errors.
- Supports human and `--json` outputs with deterministic invalid finding codes.

## Notes
Schema validation of known member types is tracked separately.

title: PRM-PACK-0012: witness append policy
description:
Implement ambient witness recording for pack command outcomes.

## Acceptance Criteria
- seal and verify append witness records by default.
- --no-witness suppresses writes without changing domain exits.
- Witness write failures warn on stderr and do not alter domain result.

## Notes
Do not record witness query subcommands.

title: PRM-PACK-0032: deferred pack pull wrapper
description:
Implement deferred `pack pull` wrapper.

## Acceptance Criteria
- `pack pull <PACK_ID> --out <DIR>` fetches manifest + members and materializes to output directory.
- Successful fetch returns exit 0 with deterministic status output.
- Transport/server/not-found failures map to refusal envelope (exit 2).

## Notes
Depends on shared transport shim.

title: PRM-PACK-0015: --schema output
description:
Implement --schema output for pack.v0 and verify schema discovery behavior.

## Acceptance Criteria
- --schema prints valid JSON Schema and exits 0 before input validation.
- Schema captures manifest/member contracts plus verify-check shape fields used by pack verify JSON output.
- Regression test validates required fields and deterministic schema shape.

## Notes
Runtime contract discovery parity bead.

title: PRM-PACK-0013: witness query CLI
description:
Implement pack witness query/last/count subcommands.

## Acceptance Criteria
- query/last/count work against ledger with deterministic filtering.
- Human and --json output supported for witness queries.
- Empty/no-match behavior follows spine witness conventions.

## Notes
Depends on witness ledger model from append policy bead.

title: PRM-PACK-0029: CI integration/smoke + ci-success
description:
Add CI integration/smoke lanes and required-check aggregation.

## Acceptance Criteria
- CI includes explicit integration lane and CLI smoke lane that execute in CI runners.
- Integration/smoke lane names are stable and deterministic for branch-protection configuration.
- Adds final `ci-success` aggregation job suitable as one stable required branch-protection check.
- Aggregator checks fmt/clippy/unit/integration/smoke lane results and fails when any required lane fails.
- Failure output includes concise local reproduction commands.

## Notes
Complements core fmt/clippy/unit CI baseline.

title: PRM-PACK-0003: refusal system + envelope
description:
Implement refusal codes and envelope output for pack.v0.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Codes implemented: E_EMPTY, E_IO, E_DUPLICATE, E_BAD_PACK.
- Refusal envelope emitted on stdout with exit code 2.
- Detail payloads are deterministic and testable.

## Notes
No command-specific business logic beyond mapping.

title: PRM-PACK-0021: release workflow parity with rvl
description:
Orchestrate release workflow parity with rvl for pack.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Release orchestration wires version/tag lifecycle and changelog or release-note generation for standard releases.
- Workflow composes the split release beads (`PRM-PACK-0027` and `PRM-PACK-0028`) into one coherent path.
- Downstream publish flow is idempotent for reruns on the same version/tag.
- Workflow failure output is actionable (clear failing stage + reproduction hint).

## Notes
Focus is orchestration and composition; build matrix and release artifact generation are tracked in dedicated beads.

title: PRM-PACK-0023: AGENTS.md swarm coordination contract
description:
Create AGENTS.md with explicit multi-agent coordination rules for pack repo.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Includes a kickoff checklist requiring AGENTS and README read-through before coding and explicit br ready guidance for next-task selection.
- Contains reservation policy with concrete allowed and forbidden examples (specific files allowed; broad globs and directories forbidden).
- Includes instruction to expect concurrent local edits from other agents and avoid destructive commands while reconciling.

## Notes
Documentation/process bead only.

title: PRM-PACK-0016: fixture corpus
description:
Build deterministic fixture corpus for seal/verify/refusal scenarios.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Fixtures include valid artifacts, nested dirs, duplicate-name inputs, tampered packs, unsafe member paths, duplicate/reserved member path manifests, and extra-member packs.
- Includes schema fixtures for known-type validation pass/fail/skipped scenarios.
- Includes at least one non-regular member fixture strategy for CI-safe validation.
- Fixture README maps each fixture to intended unit/integration/smoke test families.
- Fixture bytes are stable and reusable across test suites.

## Notes
Data-only bead.

title: PRM-PACK-0006: member copy + bytes hashing
description:
Implement byte-for-byte member copy into output directory and member sha256 computation.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Copied bytes are identical to source bytes for every member.
- bytes_hash recorded as sha256:<hex> for each copied member.
- Copy and hashing behavior is deterministic across runs.

## Notes
Exclude manifest from member set.

title: PRM-PACK-0001: scaffold crate + CLI surface
description:
Build crate skeleton and clap subcommand tree for pack.

## Acceptance Criteria
- src/main.rs + src/lib.rs with run() -> u8 exit mapping.
- CLI includes seal/verify/witness and deferred stubs for diff/push/pull.
- Global flags wired: --describe, --schema, --version, --no-witness.

## Notes
Plumbing only; no domain logic.
